resources.string: How many hours to adjust incoming messages
Only adjust when SMS time is in the future.
This setting determines how the times of incoming messages will be altered. There are three methods available to choose from:
This method will dynamically determine how to offset your messages by using your current time zone as the offset value. If you are GMT-5:00 then your messages will be offset by 5 hours.
This method allows you to specify the number of hours to offset incoming messages.

This method uses the phone\'s current time as the sent time for all incoming messages. Keep in mind, however, that this method ignores when a message was actually sent, and instead uses when it was received by your phone.

The offset is the number of hours that you want incoming messages to be shifted by. For example, if a message received at 5:00 PM is being displayed as 1:00PM, then you need to set the offset to 4 to add four hours to your incoming messages. \nNOTE: The offset can be negative!
This is a setting for CDMA users with roaming problems. This will only alter the time of an incoming message if the time on the message is in the future.
